intro: Xylosma paucinervosa, commonly known as the slender xylosma, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves with few veins. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release seeds when mature. Xylosma paucinervosa is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
